answers.answer: You stated that you are currently euthroid on 88 mcg synthroid....... what are your actual thyroid hormone levels?  That would be TSH, Free T3 and Free T4.  Please post those results along with the reference ranges from your lab report, as these vary from lab to lab, so must come from your own report.Vitamin D deficiency can cause a myriad of symptoms, as can vitamin B12 deficiency.  You might want to look into pernicious anemia.

question: My doctors are at a quandry..June 2010 left adrenalectomy for two oncocytic adrenal adenomas that were synaptophysin positive preop behaved like pheochromocytoma as well as on or table, october 2010 symptoms of severe fatigue,hair loss, bone pain especially upper arms. itching, occasional sweats and  flushing serial blood work shows moderate elevation of thyroglobulin and thyroid peroxidase that continues to rise.. hx 1994 of myxedema,cmv and severe hashimotos thyroiditis. currently euthyroid on 0.88mcg synthroid. ANA that went from positive speckled to nucleolar to homogeneous, elevated Iga,white count high normal to slightly elevated C3 and C4 elevated to high normal, prenanolone low, ferritin low to now normal with iron replacement, vitimin d low despite aggressive replacement, small bowel capsule study positive for a severely inflammed spot, negative enterographic ct, thyroid sonogram reveals swelling with new onset nodules...sub pleural densitiy on left lung that pulmonologist states to wait and watch, history for hylane variant Castlemen's disease in 1991.cardiac history positive for 2 stents ostium lad, currently also positive for controlled insulin dependent diabetes  A1c 6.2. rheumatologist thinks its oncological, oncologist thinks its rheumatalogical and internist and endocrinologist are currently resending path from adrenalectomy for re review.. bone scan, pet scan negativegi is waiting to for further endo opinion. in the meantime the bone pain in my upper arms is horrible, im fatigued, having trouble concentrating, staying asleep is difficult.Please help
title: Help competeing symptoms
